Keywords: Dark Knights , Kryptonian , Metropolis , Monster , Secret Six
Real Name: Kara Zor-El
Special Powers
SECRET SIX: Outwit. // Supergirl modifies attack +1 when attacking 1+ characters with a shared keyword. // If there are 6+ friendly characters with the Secret Six keyword on your force, opposing characters can't use Protected: Outwit or SAFEGUARD: Outwit.
I'M HERE TO GIVE YOU A CHOICE: When Supergirl would damage a character without an Infection token, give them an Infection token. // Characters with Infection tokens gain the Monster keyword.
CHOOSE MY WAY THIS TIME AND NEXT TIME IT WILL BE EVEN EASIER: Poison. When Supergirl uses it, characters within range and with Infection tokens are considered adjacent and damage dealt to them is penetrating.

July 21, 2021
outbanks
There's another, easier point to consider. If they had meant that either of the conditions needed to be met, not both, they would have used the word "or"
July 18, 2021
Brentmcampbell
That's a totally fair and well reasoned assesment. I still stand by getting rid of the "and" though. Thanks for the help.
July 18, 2021
Organous
Take the basic example you'll see all the time of effects that say "characters within range [b]and[/b] line of fire." This obviously means that both of these conditions must be met. If it didn't, it would mean that everyone within a character's range and everyone they can see map-wide could be targeted. Just to quickly find an example, I searched for specifically "characters within range and line of fire." Smeagol was the first up. [quote] SWORN TO SERVE THE MASTER OF THE PRECIOUS: Smeagol can use Perplex. He can use it normally, of he can modify the same combat value of all characters within range and line of fire with the Ringbearer keyword by +1.[/quote] By the interpretation you're trying to get of "and" here, Smeagol is able to Perplex everyone within his minimum range of 6, regardless of whether he can see them, and everyone he can see regardless of how far away they are. You have an effect setting two conditions via "and." Both of them need to be met. If either one could apply it would say "characters with [condition X] and characters with [condition Y]."
July 18, 2021
fastcat99
Yeah, but it says characters within range and WITH infection tokens. So it's as much the AND as it is the 'with' in this case.
July 17, 2021
Brentmcampbell
Does "and" consistently mean that in Heroclix? My reasoning is that if the intention was that ONLY the characters with Infection tokens would be poisoned then they would have just left out the "and". Then it would say "characters within range with Infection tokens are considered adjacent".
July 17, 2021
Coyote's Own
Ruel s qustion are better suited the rules forum but: "When Supergirl uses it, characters within range [U]and[/U] with Infection tokens are considered adjacent and damage dealt to them is penetrating." "and" means that character needs to fulfill both criteria.

So I have this figure and this question came up when playing yesterday. Is her penetrating poison supposed to work on all characters within range or just ones with infection tokens? I feel like it could be read either way.
